title: Opening Sublime Text from Bash on Ubuntu on Windows
body:
As @AFR already pointed out you can't do that as your sublime version is made for windows - and the error tells you exactly that - the included linux does not know what to do with content of your .exe.

What microsoft wants to achieve with bash on ubuntu on windows is that they enable you to run bash and other linux tools inside of windows - but you still can't run windows binaries inside of linux - if you want to run sublime text in linux you need to install it there.

You can find the sublime version here and a how to for generally installing things inside of your embedded linux there.

UPDATE: in case of sublime apt-get will not work, as sublime is not available in the official repositories - but you can follow their instructions to download a .deb file and afterwards check this source

UPDATE2: i just realized that the embedded linux might miss an x server to finally launch the GUI properly... on top found an explanaition to install X inside of windows 10's ubuntu. But to be honest i don't think it is worth it.
